programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "A Sticky Situation" - Before the challenge begins, the designers are asked to re-pick their teams. Then, in teams of two, the designers are tasked with making a prom dress out of duct tape. In addition to the Runway, they are also judged on their work by a group of high school students, whose votes factor into their final score. Two designers are eliminated.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Take it All Off" - Regrouping once again, the judges decide which designers they would like to see work together, and the teams are separated into two teams of four. The designers must make cohesive looks for the male dance troupe Thunder From Down Under. Not only must they execute menswear, but their designs must be able to "tear away" onstage as part of their performance.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "He Said, She Said" - In new teams of twos and threes, the designers make a ready-to-wear look for Lord and Taylor, inspired by their famous rose design. The winning design is manufactured and sold at Lord and Taylor for Spring 2013.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "The Art of Fashion" - In pairs again, the designers use HP technology and inspiration drawn from the Guggenheim Museum to create two looks: one avant-garde and a second ready-to-wear piece. They are also able to design their fabric for this challenge.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Finally On My Own" - After working in teams all season, the designers are relieved when they receive the news that they will now be working on their own. However, some of the eliminated designers return to act as assistants and help the competitors complete their look. For this challenge, the designers must make a Spring 2013 editorial look to be worn by actress Jordana Brewster and featured in Marie Claire.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Europe, Here We Come" - The remaining designers are paired with new assistants and each sent to a European fashion capital: Paris, Barcelona, London, and Berlin. One unlucky designer stays in NYC. The designers must draw inspiration from their city, as well as purchase their materials there. Upon returning to NYC, they must create a look for the judges that will prove they have what it takes to design a collection for Fashion Week.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Finale Part 2" - It's the moment of truth for the remaining designers as they each present their final collections to an eager audience at Mercedes Benz Fashion Week. One designer is named the winner of Project Runway Season 11, and the rest are unfortunately out.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Reunion Special" - All of the designers get to meet with each other one more time to talk about their experiences while on Project Runway Season 11. The designers seize the opportunity to celebrate the winner and iron out any issues that may need resolving. While their discussion gets heated at times, their time together is revealing and cathartic for everybody.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Road To the Runway" - Tim Gunn introduces everyone to 15 new designers who will be competing against each other on Project Runway Season 12. He also teases the fact that one of three former designers, chosen strictly by the fans, will be rejoining the competition this season. Former alumni Nick Verreos and Michelle Lesniak Franklin provide their personal commentary about the designers. Tim Gunn introduces everyone to 15 new designers who will be competing against each other on Project Runway Season 12. He also teases the fact that one of three former designers, chosen strictly by the fans, will be rejoining the competition this season. Former alumni Nick Verreos and Michelle Lesniak Franklin provide their personal commentary about the designers.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "The Sky's the Limit" - In the season premiere, we meet 15 brand new designers on an airfield outside of NYC, and learn from Heidi and Tim that Kate (Season 11) will be rejoining the competition. The new designers witness a spectacular skydive that ends with their first challenge: Design a look that represents their aesthetic, but only using parachutes as material.

programme.title: Project Runway
programme.desc: "Million-Dollar Runway" - The designers are surprised to see armed security guards arrive on the Runway...until their models step out wearing millions of dollars of exquisite jewels. The designers must create a look based around the model, and jewelry, of their choosing.

programme.title: Still
programme.desc: Faced with the day-to-day survival of life outside shelter, a simple request by someone in the group leads to a bizarre but enlightening mission.

programme.title: Alone
programme.desc: As one group finds what may be an ideal shelter, another group comes to realize that the best protection comes from those around them.

programme.title: California: Pacific Coast Highway
programme.desc: On this ride up the PCH, Norman and his friend Imogen check out some beach dune buggies, ride the bike of the future and drop in on a podcast.

programme.title: Twice as Far
programme.desc: Two different groups leave Alexandria on supply runs. While both are concerned with the future of the community, immediate danger will derail them.

programme.title: Talking Dead on "Twice as Far"
programme.desc: Josh McDermitt & Christian Serratos discuss the episode, "Twice as Far," from the hit show The Walking Dead. Host Chris Hardwick.

programme.title: Ouroboros
programme.desc: Madison confronts Strand about his mysterious destination. Nick, Alicia, and others inspect wreckage from a plane crash.

programme.title: Talking Dead: Fear the Walking Dead 203
programme.desc: Cast & guests discuss the latest episode of the hit show, Fear The Walking Dead. Hosted by Chris Hardwick.

programme.title: California: Pacific Coast Highway
programme.desc: On this ride up the PCH, Norman and his friend Imogen check out some beach dune buggies, ride the bike of the future and drop in on a podcast.

programme.title: On Location of Fear the Walking Dead V2
programme.desc: Get a behind the scenes look at the locations used on the first three seasons of Fear the Walking Dead.

programme.title: Twice as Far
programme.desc: Two different groups leave Alexandria on supply runs. While both are concerned with the future of the community, immediate danger will derail them.

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: Astronomer George Herbert (C. Thomas Howell) is assigned to investigate reports of strange meteors crashing into earth near New York, Los Angeles and Washington, D.C. As the meteors land, enormous multi-limbed metal creatures disembark and begin destroying everything and everyone in their path with heat-ray guns. Amidst the apocalyptic destruction, Herbert teams with a soldier (Andy Lauer) and a pastor (Rhett Giles) on his journey into Washington to reunite with his family.

programme.title: 40 Days and Nights
programme.desc: When a colossal tectonic shift causes the sea level to start rising, a microbiologist gathers the DNA of as many species as she can, while the military creates an "ark" in a desperate attempt to preserve life on Earth.

programme.title: Android Cop
programme.desc: In this futuristic, action-packed thriller, a cop and his robotic partner enter the Zone, a forbidden section of the city inhabited by a disease-stricken populace. Together, they discover the real reason everyone is sick, and attempt to stop the illness - with the help of the machine's powerful technology and weaponry.

programme.title: Battle of Los Angeles
programme.desc: In February 1942 US forces engaged an unidentified flying object above Los Angeles. Now almost 70 years later, the alien invaders have returned.

programme.title: Dragonquest
programme.desc: After the ruthless Krill (Brian Thompson) harnesses the power of a deadly fire-breathing dragon, he begins a bloody campaign of world domination. From the ashes of a scorched village, Arkadi (Daniel Bonjour), an unassuming farm boy, embarks on an arduous journey to restore the lost pieces of a mystical amulet -- the only weapon powerful enough to destroy Krill. With the help of swordsman Maxim (Marc Singer) and his squire, Katya (Jennifer Dorogi), Arkadi struggles to save the world.

programme.title: Amityville: It's About Time
programme.desc: A widowed father brings an evil antique clock home from a business trip for his teenage kids.

programme.title: Other Space, S1 E1 | Into the Great Beyond... Beyond
programme.desc: Young Stewart Lipinski is made captain of an exploratory space mission into space...his older sister Karen is made his second in command, and is none too happy about it. When their ship and crew stumble into a different universe with no way home, Stewart and Karen have to figure out their differences in order to survive.

programme.title: Other Space, S1 E2 | Getting to Know You
programme.desc: In an attempt to raise the morale of his frightened and fudge-riddled crew, Stewart initiates a bonding session that devolves into ice-breaker games. When Karen discovers that one of the crew members is actually an alien who's implanted memories in their heads, they play a high-stakes game of Mafia to weed out the intruder.

programme.title: Other Space, S1 E3 | The Death of A.R.T.
programme.desc: The crew prepares a video to broadcast to anyone that might be listening in space. ART gets knocked off the ship and then saves the crew when a planet starts to form around the ship.

programme.title: Other Space, S1 E4 | Ted Talks
programme.desc: Tina finds a way to get dumped by her Earthbound boyfriend despite having no contact with Earth. The ship turns out to be infested with spyware, but not the way you would think.

programme.title: Other Space, S1 E5 | Trouble's Brewing
programme.desc: Kent, Art and Natasha demand human privileges, but a coffee maker hijacks their robot revolution and takes over the ship. Meanwhile, time distortion turns Tina and Michael's half-day mission into a year-long ordeal on a barren planet.

programme.title: Other Space, S1 E6 | Powerless
programme.desc: With the ship trapped in a lightning storm, Karen struggles to persuade the crew to limit their power usage, while Stewart learns to pilot the ship manually with help from Zalian. Meanwhile, Kent attempts to re-educate Natasha, who has been reduced to the mental age of a child after the first lightning strike.

programme.title: DUST Collection | Invasions
programme.desc: How will the world confront an alien invasion will depend a lot on the visitors. Meet our potential galactic neighbors.

programme.title: DUST Collection | Adventures
programme.desc: Brave new worlds and amazing locales await in the new wild frontier of outer space adventures. What will you explore?

programme.title: Would You Believe It?, S1 E1 | Mummy in a Catalogue
programme.desc: We explore the stories of a mummy's sarcophagus being sold in a holiday catalogue, Ben Franklin's glass harmonica, and a drunk elephant's rampage through Maine.

programme.title: Would You Believe It?, S1 E2 | America's First Alien Abduction
programme.desc: We explore the stories of a man who paints a mountain in California, America's first alien abduction, as well as the stories about Gettysburg that your teachers left out.

programme.title: Would You Believe It?, S1 E3 | The Handprint in the Jail Cell
programme.desc: We explore the stories of a war between mobsters over artichokes, as well as the story of an innocent man facing execution who leaves behind a handprint on his cell's wall that won't go away.

programme.title: Would You Believe It?, S1 E4 | Aliens in New England
programme.desc: We explore the stories of a British priest who dressed as a mermaid, a father and son who created over 3,000 glass flowers, and a small town in New England that was besieged by UFOs.

programme.title: Would You Believe It?, S1 E5 | Oddities in Pennsylvania
programme.desc: We explore the stories of a museum of medical oddities, three friends whose fates are all tied to the Battle of Gettysburg, as well as the town of Punxsutawney and their celebrated groundhog.

programme.title: Code of Silence
programme.desc: Chicago detective Eddie Cusack (Chuck Norris) plays by his own rules - a dangerous habit, especially when he breaks the "code of silence" to blow the lid off a deadly police cover-up. Now an outcast, he receives little help from his embittered fellow officers when he's hurled into a blistering battle against rival drug kingpins. But Cusack is a one-man army, waging war on the criminals with his razor-sharp wits, lightning-fast karate moves and a remote-controlled, rocket-equipped tank!

programme.title: Futureworld
programme.desc: Do you remember that disaster at Delos a few years ago when the "Westworld" robots went out of control and killed a few guests? Well, the entire resort has now been rebuilt and redesigned to be completely fail-safe. To combat lingering adverse publicity, the Delos corporation has offered two reporters (Peter Fonda, Blythe Danner) exclusive rights to the "new" Delos story. But as the reporters start their private tour, they get the feeling that the resort may not be as safe as Delos claims...

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Dalton (Patrick Swayze) drives a Mercedes Benz, holds a degree in philosophy from NYU and makes lots of money. He's been shot at, stabbed and has broken most of the bones in his body. He also has a flip side - he's the best bar bouncer in the business. When Dalton's brought in to clean up a popular establishment that has become particularly rowdy, his calm is put to the test by the nasty local kingpin (Ben Gazzara) in this throwback to the great westerns of the 40s and 50s.

programme.title: Mr. Brooks
programme.desc: Consider Mr. Brooks. A successful businessman, a generous philanthropist, a loving father and devoted husband. Seemingly, he's perfect. But Mr. Brooks has a secret -- he is an insatiable serial killer, so lethally clever that no one has ever suspected him -- until now.

programme.title: Steve Rifkind Crowns Eminem as The Best Rapper of All-Time | Complex Brackets

programme.title: Lil Yachty vs Conceited in a Sneaker Battle From Home | #LIFEATCOMPLEX

I won't spoil anything for the viewers but a lot of back and forth took place along with tons of hilarity! Watch the episode and let us know who won this battle!

programme.title: Allen Iverson Reminds Us Why He's The Best Dressed NBA Player Ever | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: On this week's episode of "Tunnel Takedown," we're live from ComplexCon 2019 in Long Beach with special guest and NBA style legend Allen Iverson! In addition to discussing which NBA players were the best and worst dressed of the week, we take a look at some of A.I's past fits while in the league and discuss the influence he still has on current player's fashion. Iverson also tells stories about the backlash he received for not sticking to the NBA's former uniform dress code, plus more!

programme.title: James Harden's Cozy Fit Costs as Much as a New Car | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: On this episode of 'Tunnel Takedown,' the hosts talk PJ Tucker's latest outfit, how players tone down their fits in smaller cities, the '90s Starter jacket trend still being in style today, and Racks Hogan explains his beef with Amiri. They even try to guess the costs of outfits from superstars like James Harden and Ben Simmons. The numbers may surprise you.

programme.title: NikeStories vs Nick Engvall in a Sneaker Battle From Home! | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: On this episode of Sneaker Battle From Home, we put two OG's in the sneaker space against one another. In one corner we have Drew Hammell, also known as NikeStories, and in the other corner we have founder of "Sneaker History" and veteran writer in the sneaker blog space, Nick Engvall. These two go head to head in a versatile five round battle! We get to see some classic gems, we haven't seen in a while. Check it out for yourselves and let us know who won this battle!

programme.title: Josh Luber of StockX vs Charlotte Hornets Bismack Biyombo in a Sneaker Battle | #LIFEATCOMPLEX
programme.desc: (Episode shot on 5/26/2020) On this episode of #LIFEATCOMPLEX Presents Sneaker Battle, we have a "David vs Goliath" battle! In one corner he is the co-founder of one of the largest online sneaker marketplaces in the world, StockX's very own Josh Luber is here to battle! And in the other corner, he is the biggest competitor we've had so far, literally! Standing in at 6 foot 8 inches tall, center for the Charlotte Hornets, Bismak Biyombo is here to throw down in the sneaker gauntlet!

programme.title: NBA Champion Matt Barnes Reveals His Worst Dressed Teammate | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: Welcome back to the premiere episode of "Tunnel Takedown" season 2 hosted by Racks Hogan Complex's vet stylist stoner, Matt Barnes 14-year NBA tunnel vet, NBA champion and hooping stoner and Gia Seo Creative Director and sockfluencer as they break down the best and worst fits from some of your favorite NBA players walking the tunnel.

programme.title: Kelly Oubre Channels His Rockstar Energy while Chris Paul's Fit Flops | Tunnel Takedown
programme.desc: This week's episode of "Tunnel Takedown" discusses players like PJ Tucker experimenting with patterns and new brands, Kelly Oubre's latest rockstar fit, overalls having a comeback thanks to players like Russell Westbrook, and the problem with wearing too many graphics at once. programme.title: Joe La Puma Breaks Down How To Pair Sneakers with Your Fits | Tunnel Takedown

programme.title: Marcus Jordan Says New Air Jordan Project Is On The Way | Tunnel Takedown

He teases an upcoming Air Jordan project with his store Trophy Room coming in 2020, and gives his thoughts on the latest fits from stars like Kemba Walker and PJ Tucker. Host Racks Hogan, NBA champion Matt Barnes, and Creative Director Gia Seo also discuss Carmelo Anthony's style to celebrate his recent return to the NBA and roast some more of the league's most flagrant fits.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Snake Bite" - Four couples compete for a grand prize of $50,000. In order to win they must face getting catapulted off the top of a tall building, transfer snakes with theirs mouths and transfers flags to a partner hanging under a helicopter, all while riding a personal watercraft.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Roach Coach" - Four teams of two compete for $50,000 as they are locked in a cage and sunk underwater, eat a disgusting meal from the Fear Factor Roach Coach consisting of roaches, grasshoppers, blood salsa and maggots and lastly must leap back and forth from a moving station wagon onto a bus.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Broken Hearts & Blood Baths" - Four teams of exes must deal with 3 stunts and each other. In order to win $50,000 they must launch a car into a lake while being strapped in, dive for cow hearts in thousands of gallons of blood, and deal with the most difficult Fear Factor stunt ever as they run, fly, swim and climb while trying to blow up a fueling station.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Tall Crappacino" - Four teams of two attempt to win $50,000. They face three extreme stunts as they are stuck in a car being flown under two helicopters, must drink a Fear Factor Crappacino and lastly are dropped through a collapsing tower.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: "Scorpion Tales" - Four teams of family members compete for $50,000 as they careen into a quarry full of live ammunition while in the back of a truck, must devour nasty scorpions, and are strapped to the front of a cement truck as it smashes through structures.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Burger King Viewers Choice" - Contestants launch over a farmhouse into a pit of mud, evade attack dogs while searching for hubcaps in a junkyard and there is a very large explosion.

programme.title: Fear Factor
programme.desc: "Military Fear Factor" - Teams of women and men from the Army, Navy and Air Force compete against each other.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: 'The Bees Are So Angry, Part 1" - Five teams of two compete for $100,000 dollars on a five stunt, 2 hour spectacular as they are flown underneath the belly of a helicopter, have to eat bees, are launched off a building through glass, deal with the horror of bull testicles and drive a car through the back of a moving semi truck.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: 'The Bees Are So Angry, Part 2" - Five teams of two compete for $100,000 dollars on a five stunt, 2 hour spectacular as they are flown underneath the belly of a helicopter, have to eat bees, are launched off a building through glass, deal with the horror of bull testicles and drive a car through the back of a moving semi truck.

programme.title: Fear Factor 2.0
programme.desc: 'Leeches & Shaved Heads & Tear Gas, Part 1" - In a special 2 hour Fear Factor five teams of 2 are bungied off a cliff while tied under a helicopter, must eat leeches, must run through a burning building, deal with the Wheel of Misfortune, and finally grab flags off a moving car while dangling of a crane. All is the hopes of winning $100,000.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: The Rubberbandits look back over an action-packed second series filled with ridiculous challenges and crazy contestants as they hand-pick their highlights from the show's recent run. Which of the curiously-named challenges will feature as they count down their top ten favourite contestants from the series?

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Wipeout Australia debunks the myth that only young, fit and funky people should go on game shows.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This is the 'Last Chance Saloon' special's episode. Contestants take on four hard and tough games with the western films' sound effects and the accompaniment of Amanda Byram and Richard Hammond. They also welcome back favourites from the previous four series such as Man Mountain Syed, Rock God John and Total Wipeout's most famous couple 'Charlardo'.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jam-packed with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Stand by for foam-padded action. It's another high-octane, low-pain-threshold edition of crazed knockabout game show Total Wipeout. Richard Hammond, as your host, will be arching an eyebrow at the ludicrous antics of 20 more over-excited contestants, who have thrown caution to the wind on Argentina's famous Total Wipeout course.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond and co-host Amanda Byram return to guide 20 foolhardy Brits through the biggest and daftest obstacle course in the universe. From giant hammers that smack them in the face, to the Shapeshifter and the Big Red Balls, each contestant braves the Qualifier to try and qualify for Double Cross.

programme.title: The Almost Impossible Gameshow
programme.desc: The aim of the game is to complete five challenges without losing all their lives. Challenges tonight include Cream Fling and Yum Yum Rum.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Life really doesn't get much more fabulous than watching 20 hopeful - and sometimes hopeless - ordinary British folk fly halfway across the world to test their skill, endurance, nerve and bouncability on the incredible Total Wipeout course in Argentina. There is a cash prize waiting for the winner, plus a shiny trophy, a lifetime of amusing anecdotes, and a nickname from host Richard Hammond.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Total Wipeout, the biggest, brashest and most exhausting game show on television, is back for more bangs, bumps, and bruises. This episode sees the return of the finalists from across the series as they compete for the ultimate title, 'Champions of Champions'. They pit themselves against some of the hardest obstacles we've ever witnessed on their journey to get to the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Pork Tacos and Churros
programme.desc: Julia Collin Davison prepares showstopping Citrus-Braised Pork Tacos. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop conducts a mild salsa taste test. Next, test cook Christie Morrison shows Julia how to make unforgettable So-Cal-inspired Churros. And finally, equipment expert Adam Ried shares his favorite piping set.

programme.title: BBQ Thighs and Fried Peach Pies
programme.desc: Julia Collin Davison unveils the secrets to the ultimate Barbecue Chicken Thighs to host, Bridget Lancaster. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a tasting of popcorn. And finally, test cook Bryan Roof demonstrates how to make Fried Peach Pies at home.

programme.title: Tex-Mex Favorites
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster make a Lone Star State classic-Flank Steak in Adobo. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for inexpensive blenders. And finally, test cook Ashley Moore shows Julia how to make the ultimate Texas Breakfast Tacos.

programme.title: Spaghetti House Classics
programme.desc: Test cook Christie Morrison makes host Julia Collin Davison the perfect Hearty Beef Lasagna. Then, tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of block mozzarella. And finally, test cook Lan Lam makes Bridget a new weeknight favorite-Chicken Scarpariello.

programme.title: Korean Feast
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison shows host Bridget Lancaster how to make dolsot bibimbap. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews spider skimmers in the equipment corner. Finally, test cook Dan Souza prepares Korean-style fried chicken wings.

programme.title: Autumn Desserts
programme.desc: Host Bridget Lancaster goes into the test kitchen with host Julia Collin Davison to learn how to make the ultimate Chewy Oatmeal Cookies. Then, equipment expert Adam Ried reviews mini prep bowls in the Equipment Corner. Finally, test cook Elle Simone reveals the secrets to Ultranutty Pecan Bars.

programme.title: How to Roast Everything
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia teach viewers how to make the ultimate Beef Tenderloin with Smoky Potatoes and Persillade Relish. Tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Bridget to a turkey tasting. Gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews fat separators, and then test cook Dan Souza makes Turkey Breast en Cocotte with Pan Gravy.

programme.title: Pad Thai and Panang Curry
programme.desc: Bridget and Julia prepare pad thai. Tasting expert Jack Bishop conducts a tasting of coconut milk. Next, gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews electric kettles. And finally, test cook Elle Simone makes panang beef curry.

programme.title: Pork Patties and Steak on the Grill
programme.desc: Hosts Bridget and Julia prepare bun cha on the grill. Next, equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for kitchen shears. Finally, Dan and Julia make negimaki.

programme.title: Pork Chops and Oven Fries
programme.desc: In this episode, test cook Elle Simone makes Bridget the ultimate Deviled Pork Chops. Then tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges Julia to a tasting of dark chocolate chips, and gadget critic Lisa McManus reviews kids' oven mitts. Science expert Dan Souza reveals the science behind non-Newtonian fluids, and test cook Lan Lam makes the perfect Thick-Cut Oven Fries.

programme.title: Barbecued Salmon
programme.desc: We were intrigued with the notion of barbecuing a whole side of salmon. Our goal was to have this large piece of fish spend enough time over the coals to pick up some real wood flavor. A bright cucumber salad adds cool, tart, and creamy flavors to complement the smoke-flavored salmon.

programme.title: Bistro Basics
programme.desc: Bistro classics, such as steak au poivre and crème brulée, offer a taste of real French cooking without pretension. We show you how to create these dishes without spending all day in the kitchen.

programme.title: Steak Tips
programme.desc: We felt confident that we could rescue steak tips and fries and turn them into something you would love.

programme.title: Favorite Italian Classics
programme.desc: We demonstrate Italian dishes: Grilled Chicken alla Diavola, Frico, and Strawberries with Balsamic Vinegar.

programme.title: Appetizers
programme.desc: We like appetizers that deliver big flavor without much work. This means spiced nuts that are not overly sweet, spinach dip that is bold and creamy (not watery and insipid), and beef satay that is tender and vibrant.

programme.title: Regional Classics
programme.desc: Some local dishes become so popular that they transcend their region. Gumbo is a taste of Louisiana in a big old bowl. And Cincinnati chili is American original, served with buttered spaghetti, kidney beans, cheddar cheese, and chopped onions. Our goal when developing our versions of these dishes was to remain faithful to the originals while making the recipes approachable for cooks who may not have grown up with them.

programme.title: Rethinking Barbecued Chicken
programme.desc: If you're a fan of saucy barbecued chicken, you'll love pulled chicken. Similar to the more traditional pulled pork, it's simply tender shreds of smoky grilled chicken moistened with barbecue sauce. We set out to develop pulled chicken that could be as good as pulled pork, not just a close second.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Tomatoes
programme.desc: Take Tomatoes to the next level with Mushroom and Tomato Bell Pepper Quiche, Spicy Corn Tomato Relish, Tomato Basil Salad.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Kaspar Donier, Kevin Rathbun, and Keegan Gerhard
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Pickled Chanterelles, Boar Chops and Cous Cous, and Roasted Apples with Warm Apple Soup. Restaurants include: Kaspar’s in Seattle, Nava in Atlanta, and The Ritz-Carlton in Naples.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Noodle and Dumpling Chronicles
programme.desc: Like an Italian with a bowl of spaghetti or tortellini, a Korean eating a heap of noodles or dumplings is a satisfied customer. In Korea, slurping is not only permitted, it’s considered a compliment to the cook. This episode features a restaurant in Seoul known for its nenngymyun, an unusual dish of elastic buckwheat noodles served with ice-cold beef broth.

programme.title: A Taste of History - The Santa Fe Trail
programme.desc: Chef Staib journeys down the Santa Fe trail through Kansas to discover where travelers regrouped before the next perilous leg of their journey. Recipes like steamed venison pudding and bison stew are prepared at a local stagecoach stop.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - The Real Chefs Garden
programme.desc: In this episode we experience Seattle’s most pure, organic, direct and delicious “Farm to Table” experience with Chef Brian Scheehser. He practices sustainable farming in his own three‐acre garden, with the hand of a farmer and the meticulous nature of a chef. Part Chef‐Part Farmer, Scheehser offers expert tips on cooking and insight on how to grow your garden.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Rice Chronicles
programme.desc: Rice, the bread and butter of the Korean table is explored from Busan, Korea’s second largest city, all the way to Seoul. Along the way, Marja and her dear friend, the actress Heather Graham, learn about instant rice, tteok (a pasta-like ingredient made of ground rice) and visit Bibigo, a new chain of contemporary restaurants serving fresh variations of bibimbap.

programme.title: Great Chefs of America: Jean-Claude Poilevey, David Machado, and Norman Love
programme.desc: Recipes included with this episode: Lyonnaise Salad, Halibut Cheeks with Potatoes and Artichoke, and Banana-Chocolate Tart with Malted Milk Ice Cream. Restaurants include: Le Bouchon in Chicago, Pazzo Ristorante in Portland, and The Ritz-Carlton in Naples.

programme.title: Superfoods with Chef Walter Staib - Apples
programme.desc: See Apples in a new light when served with Green Tea Pork Tenderloin, Apple and Cranberry Cobbler and a Late Summer Superfoods Salad.

programme.title: Martin Yan - Quick and Easy - China & Korea
programme.desc: Two culinary powerhouses come together, as Martin and his guest, barbeque master Rick Browne, explore the difference between Korean and Chinese flavours to create these quick and easy dishes.

programme.title: Dine & Dish Nation - Lovers Only El Barzon The Rattlesnake Club
programme.desc: Host Kam Carman welcomes Barbara Johnson, Jarod Robert and Elizabeth Kraft, who review upscale sandwiches and salads at Lovers Only Mexican and Italian specialties a la Chef Norberto Garita at El Barzon and steaks and seafood at the Rattlesnake Club located on the Detroit Riverfront.

programme.title: Graham Kerr's Kitchen - Fruit Soufflé Omelet
programme.desc: Use low-fat egg substitute in a sweet fruit omelet topped with creamy orange sauce or a mushroom and spinach omelet with fresh dill and Parmesan cheese.

programme.title: Hawaii Cooks with Roy Yamaguchi - Oodles of Noodles
programme.desc: A visit to Crown noodle factory in Honolulu reveals the fine art of noodle making. This episode also features a variety of Asian and Italian pasta dishes such as Vietnamese Summer Rolls, Chicken Macadamia Nut Pasta and Roy's Asian Pasta Primavera. Master sommelier Chuck Furuya is on hand to recommend the right wine and pasta combination.

programme.title: Justin Wilson's Easy Cookin' - Turtle Stew & Blueberry Cobbler
programme.desc: Join Justin as he demonstrates how to prepare and cook Turtle Stew & Blueberry Cobbler!

programme.title: What's For Dinner? Stir-fry Tofu with Spicy Basil Tomatoes
programme.desc: Ken and Mary Jo have a fun time in the kitchen cooking a stir-fry tofu with spicy basil tomatoes, plus a few other excellent dishes.

programme.title: A Taste of History - The Santa Fe Trail
programme.desc: Chef Staib journeys down the Santa Fe trail through Kansas to discover where travelers regrouped before the next perilous leg of their journey. Recipes like steamed venison pudding and bison stew are prepared at a local stagecoach stop.

programme.title: Chefs A' Field: Green Cuisine - The Real Chefs Garden
programme.desc: In this episode we experience Seattle’s most pure, organic, direct and delicious “Farm to Table” experience with Chef Brian Scheehser. He practices sustainable farming in his own three‐acre garden, with the hand of a farmer and the meticulous nature of a chef. Part Chef‐Part Farmer, Scheehser offers expert tips on cooking and insight on how to grow your garden.

programme.title: Kimchi Chronicles - The Rice Chronicles
programme.desc: Rice, the bread and butter of the Korean table is explored from Busan, Korea’s second largest city, all the way to Seoul. Along the way, Marja and her dear friend, the actress Heather Graham, learn about instant rice, tteok (a pasta-like ingredient made of ground rice) and visit Bibigo, a new chain of contemporary restaurants serving fresh variations of bibimbap.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Vietnam: Postal Service
programme.desc: Host Daniel Hutchinson joins the postman in delivering personal packages to the families but not before embarking on an arduous journey to where the tribes are situated.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Laos: Medical Supplies Delivery
programme.desc: Host Carla Dunareanu partners with "Bridging the Gap Mekong Trust" to travel upriver to a remote village in her special delivery of mosquito-nets and precious medical supplies.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Malaysia: Tools for a Better Life
programme.desc: Host Paul Foster journeys up the Tembeling River and into the primeval forest in search of just such a community from the Batek tribe. His mission, to deliver rice and clothes to the Batek to help them cope as their way of life is threatened by modernity.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Indonesia: Horse Mobile Library
programme.desc: Host Khai Saharom joins Ridwan Sururi in this endearing and noble effort to bring books to the villagers. On his journey, he meets Lasmi, a very shy young autistic girl whom Ridwan has successfully taught to read.

programme.title: Special Delivery - Thailand: A Life Changing Climb
programme.desc: n this episode, Host Carla Dunareanu travels to Bangkok to meet an extraordinary father-son pair.

programme.title: Special Delivery - The Philippines: Emergency Grab and Go Bags
programme.desc: Host Pei Fen volunteers with Mercy Relief for a long trek into a hilly and remote Cagayan region, bringing with her "Emergency Grab and Go Bags" that could well be a matter of life and death for the indigenous communities in the next typhoon strike.

programme.title: Special Delivery - East Malaysia: Securing Tomorrow
programme.desc: Our host, Paul Foster travels to Silk Island, Sabah - to deliver materials that will complete a sea cucumber ranch. And in doing so, becomes completely enamoured with these enchanting gypsies of the sea.

programme.title: Special Delivery - The Philippines: From War to Hope
programme.desc: For months, the battle raged between pro-ISIS rebels and government forces. When the sounds of war finally subsided, large swathes of Marawi are in ruins and its displaced population are left to pick up the pieces.

programme.title: Special Delivery - India: Solar Panel Delivery
programme.desc: In a remote part of Ladakh not even listed on Google Maps, is an unknown village in Leh that is completely devoid of electricity.

programme.title: Journy World Docs - Wheel of Life
programme.desc: Meet El Oso "The Bear,"one of the founders of Cuban Salsa— Casino de Rueda. Still on the dance floor approaching 70, his charisma and fancy footwork broke new ground for black dancers after the revolution, and helped launch a global dance phenomenon.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Dramatic Landscapes
programme.desc: Cousteau takes us to the American mid-West to see how wildlife in Yellowstone copes with the harsh winter, then we head to a Pacific island to explore some of the tallest sea cliffs in the world before venturing into the Canadian wilderness.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Artists of the Environment
programme.desc: In this episode, Cousteau explores the different ways an environmental painter, sculptor, photographer and craftsman blend nature with art.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Science on the Great Barrier Reef
programme.desc: Cousteau explores the Great Barrier Reef. He then heads to James Cook University to get an up-close look at some of the country's deadliest creatures. Philippe ends his journey by visiting the Australian Institute of Marine Science.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - New Zealand
programme.desc: Cousteau travels to New Zealand, where he explores Auckland's volcanic field and comes face-to-face with one of the largest insects on the planet.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Natural Wonders
programme.desc: Cousteau heads to Hawaii to see a waterfall of lava pouring into the ocean. We'll then visit the legendary Antelope Canyon of Arizona, walk atop a unique frozen lake in Alberta, and take a magical scuba dive into a cenote in Mexico.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Student Explorer
programme.desc: In this episode, we reveal the winner of our first ever #StudentExplorer Contest. Philippe and the lucky student then head to Mexico to swim with whale sharks in the wild.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet - Guardians of the Environment
programme.desc: Phillipe unearths some of the scientists, students and citizens working to save the planet. From creating safe havens for endangered species to introducing disadvantaged kids to the wonders of the oceans, environment guardians are making a positive impact

programme.title: Ask TOH | Crown Molding, Strip Wallpaper
programme.desc: Tom installs crown molding on cabinets with full overlay doors Richard discusses toilet seats Mauro teaches apprentice Mary how to strip wallpaper without using any chemicals.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Storage Bench, Old Shower Valve
programme.desc: In Build It, Tom and Kevin build a modern storage bench out of a single sheet of MDF and then Mauro paints it Richard travels to Seattle to help a homeowner whose shower runs cold whenever there’s a demand for hot water elsewhere in the house.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Swap Door Swing, Tropical Yard
programme.desc: The team discusses tools that make good gifts Jenn returns to her home state of Florida to help a homeowner design a tropical landscape for his backyard former apprentice Nathan returns to help Tom change the swing of an entry door.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Fireplace Makeover, Drip Edges
programme.desc: Mark replaces a chipped brick in a fireplace surround and then Mauro updates it with a whitewashed look Richard shares some advice on maintaining water heaters Tom demonstrates the importance of a properly installed drip edge

programme.title: Ask TOH | Swing Set, Robotic Construction
programme.desc: Tom travels to Colorado to help a couple build a DIY swing set for their young son Nathan demonstrates how to build saw horses using leftover materials from the jobsite in Future House, Ross learns about automated home construction.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Concrete Walkway, Jimmy DiResta
programme.desc: Mark replaces a concrete walkway with brick pavers Richard explains how gas piping is installed in a home Kevin returns to Upstate New York to build a farmhouse table with maker Jimmy DiResta.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Seismic Retrofit, Dryer Vent
programme.desc: Kevin travels to Portland, Oregon to learn how to protect homes from earthquakes Mark stains concrete in Open House, Tom explains why and how to change the locks in a new home Richard travels to Cleveland to reroute a lengthy dryer vent.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Cabinet Upgrade, Secret Garden
programme.desc: Nathan upgrades a kitchen to have soft close cabinets the team shares some home inspection nightmares Richard and Kevin discuss how gas regulators work and how their malfunction caused gas explosions in Lawrence, MA Jenn cleans up an overgrown garden and redesigns it as a secret garden.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Closet Door, Bathroom Paint
programme.desc: Tom travels to Pittsburgh to replace a bi-fold closet door with one that is more appropriate for the house Jenn discusses alternatives to flower bouquets that make great gifts Mauro paints a bathroom using a mold resistant paint.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Vertical Garden, Toilet Factory
programme.desc: Jenn installs a vertical garden to maximize space for a homeowner Tom explains the uses for different drill bits Richard travels to a plumbing facility in New Jersey to learn about advances in toilet engineering that help save water.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Stucco Repair, Gas Dryer
programme.desc: Mark travels to San Diego to repair a crack in a concrete retaining wall with a stucco finish Tom explains how air compressors work Richard helps an expecting couple select and install a gas dryer.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Paint Metal Railing, Wine Rack
programme.desc: Mauro helps a homeowner clean up and repaint a rusty, metal railing Richard discusses some innovations that can make clearing a clogged sink easier Tom and Kevin build a wine rack out of a reclaimed beam

programme.title: Ask TOH | Prairie Grasses, Solar Flower
programme.desc: Jenn partners with an ecologist in Cheyenne, Wyoming to learn about different types of prairie grasses and how to care for them Kevin learns about ways to make a home more resistant against wildfires in Future House, Ross sees a robotic, ground mounted solar array that mimics a sunflower.

programme.title: Ask TOH | Smart Irrigation, Jimmy DiResta

programme.title: Ask TOH | Fix Foundation, Textured Ceiling

programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Four" - On the fourth day, the remaining chefs compete in a blindfold taste test. The losers must accept a difficult punishment while the winners dine with Chef Ramsay.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Five" - To advance in this challenge, the seven remaining chefs must purchase and prepare food for a wedding reception.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: "Season 3, Day Six" - Melissa joins the men in a competition to see which team can prepare better lobster dishes. But there's a catch: the teams must kill their crustaceans first.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Park's Edge
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay stops at Park's Edge in Atlanta, where he finds a chaotic kitchen and severe signs of mismanagement.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Bella Luna
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay assists a family-owned Italian restaurant in Easton, Philadelphia that's struggling due to the chef's incompetence and the owner's aloofness.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Peter's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Peter's, a family-run Italian restaurant in Babylon, New York. He discovers that the eatery is sinking because of its brash manager and co-owner.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Lido di Manhattan
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Lido di Manhattan, an Italian joint with an unsightly kitchen and inexperienced owner. He is so horrified that he shuts the place down temporarily.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Capri
programme.desc: While visiting the Eagle Rock area of Los Angeles, Chef Ramsay stops by Capri. This Italian restaurant is filthy, serves terrible food and is in disarray all thanks to a lazy set of twins.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sante Le Brea
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay travels to LA to inspect Sante La Brea. He discovers a financially strapped owner who isn't respected by his staff. And an incident that occurs in the eatery leads to a police visit.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Jack's Waterfront
programme.desc: Ramsay arrives at Jack's Waterfront and is appalled by the lack of fresh seafood and inattentive management. The general manager's excessive socializing with patrons may sink the place.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: J. Willy's
programme.desc: Located in Indiana, J. Willy's Bar and Grille is deep in debt. When Chef Ramsay arrives, he challenges the owners to use fresh ingredients, but the inexperienced chefs get overwhelmed.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Sabatiello's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits Sabatiello's and finds a hot-headed owner who is deep in debt. The owner gets so angry at his employees and Ramsay's criticism that he shuts down the eatery himself.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Chappy's
programme.desc: The owners of Chappy's, a Cajun-style restaurant, had to move in the wake of Hurricane Katrina. Now in Nashville, they're struggling to find a loyal base of customers.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares: Hannah and Mason's
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay visits French bistro Hannah and Mason's. Owned by two friends who lack business skills and motivation, the restaurant administers bounced checks to the staff.

programme.title: Verdad Oculta: Episodio 41
programme.desc: Después de la caída de un infame narco-líder, el coronel Diana está lista para tomarse un descanso de la policía y trabajar para arreglar su matrimonio. Su jefe, sin embargo, tiene otros planes y le asigna al coronel Diana su mayor misión hasta la fecha: desmantelar "el Clan del Norte" dirigido por los hermanos Zurria y sus aliados oficiales corruptos y funcionarios del gobierno.

programme.title: Agua en la Boca
programme.desc: Es una historia de amor prohibido entre dos jóvenes, hijos de familias rivales. La hermosa Danielle Cassoulet (de descendencia francés) y el aventurero Luca Bellini (de descendencia italiana). El conflicto entre el cassoulet y la familia Bellini es viejo, siendo antes los mejores amigos de la juventud las matriarcas de esas familias hoy no pueden permanecer de pie debido a una disputa amorosa en el pasado en el que Françoise Cassoulet, y la abuela de Dany se peleaban por el amor de un mismo hombre.

programme.title: I'M LIVE: S1 E198
programme.desc: Joining us on this week's I'm LIVE is singer-songwriter Kwon Jin-ah! This artist became known to the public in 2013 after taking part in "K-Pop Star Season 3." 3 years later in 2016, she made her official debut with the album, "One Strange Night," and topped all the music charts with the lead single "The End." Particularly known for her delicate ability to express emotions, she has collaborated with various top-notch musicians and also taken part in many soundtracks. This past February, Kwon Jin-ah released her first collaborative single with Gaeko, "I Feel Like," and dominated the top spots of music charts again. February was definitely a busy month for this artist - she also released her EP, "The Way For Us." Due to her active participation in the creative process both as a songwriter and producer, the album beautifully displays her distinct musicality. She likens each of her songs in the EP to a short story, making her new album a collection of 6 short stories. In this episode, Kwon Jin-ah performs "Something's Wrong," "Flower Heart," "You already have," "Good Bye," "I got lucky," and The way for Us." Tune in to I'm LIVE and enjoy her beautiful songs!

programme.title: I'M LIVE: S1 E178
programme.desc: Joining us on this week's I'm LIVE are the beloved monkies of the Korean music industry - JANNABI! JANNABI is an old-fashioned Korean word for “monkey,” and this band made their debut in 2014 with the digital single, "Rocket." Since then, they have impressed numerous listeners with their retro-infused music that portrays various stories of the youth, ranging from love to separation to frustration. Last year, the band released their second full-length album, "Legend," and topped all the music charts with the album's lead track "for lovers who hesitate." Before releasing their third full-length album next year, the band dropped a new mini-album just a week ago, and this time as a duo, to nourish listeners' hearts. In this episode, JANNABI performs both their latest tracks and hit songs - "A thought on an autumn night," "Old dog," "Sweet memories," and "Step" from their new album, "JANNABI's Small Pieces 1," as well as "Summer," and "for lovers who hesitate." Tune in to I'm LIVE this week and enjoy a beautiful autumn day with these talented musicians!

programme.title: Mission Laughter
programme.desc: Episode 101 - Alright agents! Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to scour the world for the funniest perpetrators on the planet. We have eyes and ears around the globe and you, our top agent, must decipher six clues to find and detain the world's most notorious comedy criminals. This is Mission Laughter!

programme.title: Leland Klassen - More True
programme.desc: Raised on a farm in the heart of Canada, Leland quickly learned that shoveling manure and weeding potatoes, although lucrative, wasnít his passion in life. So with absolutely no clear direction or vision for his future, he did what everyone does when they find themselves in that position - he went to University. He wisely chose his classes based on whichever cute girl happened to catch his attention and after several short years of last minute cramming and late assignments, Leland graduated from the University of Saskatchewan with a degree in Anthropology. As you might have guessed, Lelandís university education opened many doors for him in the years to come, but for some reason he was dissatisfied working for a courier as a night shift stock boy. By this time married and with his first child soon on the way, the most responsible and obvious choice was, of course, to pursue a career in the entertainment industry. Starting off at amateur nights and seedy bars Leland decided right from the beginning that he would remain clean despite what everyone else was doing and as a result over the last 16 years Leland has become recognized as Canadaís premier clean comedian. With his unique intelligence and wit, Leland has carved out quite a niche for himself in the world of entertainment. Using his farm boy charm and handsome (although somewhat inbred) Mennonite good looks, Lelandís clever observations and rich life experiences are brought to life in a one-of-a-kind show. LELANDíS CREDITS: Halifax Comedy Fest 2014, Just for Laughs in Montreal, 1999, 2001, 2004 and 2014, Host of Popcorn TV, Featured on Thou Shalt Laugh 5, Host of Comedy Tournament, Co-Host GMA Canada 2009, 2012 and 2013, Promise Keepers Canada, Episode of the US syndicated comedy series ìBananasî, Two of his own television seriesí on the West Coast, as well as Appeared on numerous other programs across the United States and Canada, such as Comedy Network, CBC Television, YTV, Star TV, Global and Discovery Kids.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: John Branyan - Demeaning of Life
programme.desc: John Branyan's comedy is smart and sarcastic in perfect proportions. This special features his perspective on why God made everyone stupid and his unparalleled Shakespearean take on The Three Little Pigs.

programme.title: Jeff Allen - I Can Laugh About it Now
programme.desc: Jeff Allen combines clean, hilarious humor like no other comedian working today. Besides performing at corporate functions and fundraisers, he regularly appears on television, radio, and casinos across the country. Consistently making heroes out of meeting planners, Jeff Allen provides world-class comedy.

programme.title: Billy Anderson - America's Sweetheart
programme.desc: Born in Texas and raised in Augusta, Georgia ñ Billy Anderson is stand-up comedian currently living in Seattle, Washington. Heís been seen regionally at SketchFest Seattle, The Washington Comedy Festival, Bumbershoot and was a finalist in the 2016 Seattle International Comedy Competition. Outside of the Northwest, Billy has written for Cracked.Com, performed in SF Sketchfest, LaLaFest Los Angeles, the San Francisco International Comedy Competition and as of 2013 he has performed stand-up comedy in every US state. Billy was recently featured on Audibleís ìSounds Like Americaî hosted by Jackie Kashian and the syndicated program ìLaughsî on Fox television.

programme.title: Marc Yaffee - Mid-Laugh Crisis
programme.desc: Adopted at birth and confused ever since, Marc takes his audiences on a comedy joyride as he explores his multi-ethnic roots and the culture clashes that fill his world. Marc’s smart but relatable comedy demonstrates a universal appeal that has landed him appearances on PBS, Comics Unleashed, The Latino Laugh Festival and the Showtime special, Goin’ Native. Funny not filthy, Marc serves audiences his original comedy recipe, specially prepared for non- stop laughs. Tasty topics, spicy premises and savory punchlines, are all dished out with a dash of sarcasm and a grain of salt. A regular in Las Vegas, Marc has performed six times overseas for Armed Forces Entertainment and he’s a past winner of Ventura Comedy Festival’s Funniest Person Contest.

programme.title: Dave Burleigh - Nobody's Keeping You Here
programme.desc: Comedian and Impressionist Dave Burleigh's star is on the rise. His uncanny ability to impersonate just about anyone landed him the starring role as Charlie Sheen in "Not Another Celebrity Movie." Burleigh's multiple characters, voices, and impressions were showcased on Season 7 of America's Got Talent, where he became a fast favorite of both judges and fans alike. Judge Howard Stern said, "You have an excellent command of the stage." Fellow comedian and judge Howie Mandel added, "Your impressions were spot on." Burleigh's laid back and easy going style and persona on stage contrasted with his unique facial and body expressions are guaranteed to leave audiences amazed and impressed. As a two-time finalist in the San Francisco Comedy Competition, Burleigh now shares the first runner-up spot with past participant comedy legends like Robin Williams, Ellen DeGeneres, Marc Maron, Dane Cook and Kevin Pollak. With numerous television, podcast and radio appearances, prestigious publications like Rolling Stone are talking, "Burleigh has the trappings of a soon to be comedy star!" This talented, singer, musician, actor, comedian and host tours the world over 36 weeks a year and headlines all the major casinos in Las Vegas. Make sure to catch Dave's show at a theater or comedy club near you, as he will no doubt, leave you with a lasting impression.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Josh Blue - The Disabled List
programme.desc: Following his groundbreaking win on NBC’s Last Comic Standing in 2006, Josh Blue has risen through the ranks to become a well-established headliner at venues throughout the world.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Corey Rodrigues - People Whisperer
programme.desc: Corey is a highly sought after national touring college, club and corporate and cruise ship performer. He was the winner of The Catch a New Rising Star, The Funniest Comic in New England and the 2017 Big Sky Comedy Festivals. Rodrigues has been featured on the hilarious Gotham Live, Laughs on Fox and True Tv's Laff Mobbs Laff Tracks television shows and currently can be heard on Sirius XM. He combines comedy from his own life and the lives of those around him. Mix that with a hilarious point of view and he's able to talk about just about anything.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Maija DiGiorgio - Maija Pinion
programme.desc: Born to a black mother and an Italian father in New York City, Maija Digiorgios comedy centers on the examination of her own mixed-race identity. Digiorgio riffs on Thanksgiving with each side of her family, gender roles between the two cultlures, and her racist grandma in this special.

programme.title: Alex Velluto - Spurious
programme.desc: Like Rocky Balboa, Alex Velluto is the son of an Italian immigrant and brings the same intensity, will, and drive to the comedy stage. In 2016, Alex was voted 'Best Comedian' by City Weekly Magazine and is the winner of the Finger Lakes Comedy Festival in Ithaca, NY. Alex is a regular at Wiseguys Comedy Club where he has headlined and worked with some of the biggest names in comedy. He has also “gone the distance” in many competitions and festivals across the country. Alex was a finalist in the the Funniest Person in Utah competition, and The Salt Lake Comedy Festival stand up competition, has performed at the Idaho Laugh Festival, and Finger Lakes Comedy Festival. In addition to his stand-up comedy, Alex is a co-host of the "Happy Valley Podcast", and is renowned for referring to himself in the third person, and is an excellent writer of comedy bios about himself that everybody likes.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Brad Trackman - Thanks
programme.desc: Brad Trackman is a national touring comedian who has been featured on a number of well-known comedy shows and channels.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Orlando Baxter - Glorified Baby Sitter
programme.desc: Orlando Baxter's fresh perspective and unique relatability makes this former high school teacher a fan favorite all over the world. In 2016, Orlando made his late night TV debut on the Conan show on TBS, and since then he's appeared on the television shows "Comedy Up Late" in Australia, B.E.T.'s "50 Central" and Laff Mobb's Laff Track on Tru TV.

programme.title: Don Barnhart - The Spinal Disintegration of Man
programme.desc: Don’s ability to keep audiences of all ages howling with laughter and coming back for more is what separates him from the average joke teller.

programme.title: Tom Segura: Completely Normal
programme.desc: Tom Segura shares a few off-hand appraisals on hotels and hobbies with a cool and thoughtful demeanor in this.

programme.title: RiffTrax: The Power
programme.desc: Join Mike, Kevin, Bill, and a harmless little tiki idol that Kevin brought back from Hawaii for The Power! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Alone At Home
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to the short Alone at Home! Mike, Kevin, and Bill have not been Alone at Home for years, because their wives know they’d just eat sticks of butter and wind up sticking their fingers in the electrical outlets again.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Families: Earning And Spending
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to the educational short Families: Earning And Spending! Join Mike, Kevin and Bill and spend a little well-earned time with Families: Earning and Spending!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX LIVE - Space Mutiny
programme.desc: Space Mutiny! The very title conjures up many memories: tiny cars, writhing spandex-witches, deadly railings. Oh, and we guess there's a mutiny in there somewhere...This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - The Tale of Moose Baby
programme.desc: RiffTrax, the guys who make movies funny, bring their comedic riffing treatment to this short about Moose Baby! "But what is it about?" you quite reasonably ask. It is not about anything. It is Moose Baby. Join Mike, Kevin, and Bill for The Tale of Moose Baby!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX PRESENTS - The Amazing Mr. X
programme.desc: Ravens, crystal balls, cocktails and ….MURDER! Join Bridget and Mary Jo as they riff The Amazing Mr. X.

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - Flying Stewardess
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to the short Flying Stewardess! Hop aboard and join Mike, Kevin and Bill for Flying Stewardess!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Pressure Point
programme.desc: Sebastian Dellacourt is leading a double life: he tells his wife that he’s a humble systems analyst. But he’s actually a D-list actor starring in films by the director of Time Chasers and Radical Jack! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (formerly of MST3K).

programme.title: RIFFTRAX SHORT - The Value of Teamwork
programme.desc: The stars of MST3K bring their comedic riffing treatment to this short about a talking dog teaching his young master all about The Value of Teamwork. Be a team player and join Mike, Kevin, and Bill for this hilarious riff!

programme.title: RIFFTRAX - Superargo And The Faceless Giants
programme.desc: Join former MST3K stars Mike, Kevin, and Bill and have a blast with the meandering, low-impact heroics of Superargo and the Faceless Giants! This feature is a parody and contains the original movie combined with a comedic commentary by Mike, Kevin and Bill from RiffTrax (former stars of Mystery Science Theater 3000 aka MST3K).
